meanings.definition: Making a low, continuous humming sound.
meanings.sent1: The buzzy bee flew around the garden.
meanings.sent2: The old fridge made a buzzy noise all night.
meanings.sent3: The buzzy sound of the fan put me to sleep.
meanings.sent4: The buzzy background noise in the cafe was comforting.
meanings.sent5: The buzzy hum of the city was a constant presence.

meanings.sent1: The party was so buzzy with music and laughter.
meanings.sent2: The market was always buzzy with shoppers and vendors.
meanings.sent3: The buzzy atmosphere at the game got everyone cheering.
meanings.sent4: The buzzy energy of the city streets was contagious.
meanings.sent5: The buzzy vibe of the concert made it unforgettable.

meanings.definition: Feeling a sensation of buzzing or tingling.
meanings.sent1: After sitting for a long time, my legs felt buzzy.
meanings.sent2: The numbness wore off, leaving a buzzy feeling in my foot.
meanings.sent3: The buzzy sensation in my fingers made me shake them out.
meanings.sent4: The cold water gave me a buzzy feeling all over.
meanings.sent5: The massage left me with a pleasant buzzy tingle.
